intro: Grammosciadium macrodon subsp. nezaketae, commonly known as the Nezaketae goldenbush, is a rare and endemic plant species found in specific regions of Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and fibrous root system. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing adaptations to arid environments. Its foliage consists of narrow, grass-like leaves, and it produces small, yellow to orange flowers. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a valuable subject for botanical research and conservation efforts.
